events.title: Storming of the Tuileries Palace
events.description: French revolutionaries stormed the Tuileries Palace in Paris, leading to the suspension of King Louis XVI and marking a turning point in the French Revolution.
events.significance: Marked the radicalization of the French Revolution and the eventual abolition of the monarchy.

events.title: Battle of Wagram Ends
events.description: The Battle of Wagram between Napoleon's French army and Austrian forces ended with a decisive French victory during the Napoleonic Wars.
events.significance: Secured Napoleon's dominance in Europe and led to the Treaty of Sch√∂nbrunn.

events.title: Ecuador's Declaration of Independence
events.description: Ecuador declared its independence from Spain, a significant step in the South American wars of independence.
events.significance: Began the process of nation-building for Ecuador as part of broader Latin American independence movements.

events.title: Mexico City Earthquake
events.description: A devastating earthquake struck Mexico City, causing widespread destruction and killing thousands of people.
events.significance: Led to major changes in earthquake preparedness and urban planning in Mexico.

events.title: Poland and Lithuania Celebrate the 600th Anniversary of the Battle of Grunwald
events.description: Commemorations marked the 600th anniversary of the Battle of Grunwald, where Polish-Lithuanian forces defeated the Teutonic Knights.
events.significance: Celebrated a key historical victory symbolizing unity and strength in Polish and Lithuanian history.
